pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.4: The section on how many offenses
pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.5: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.1: (1) For having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offences does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.3: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.4: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.5: when one inserts the penis without touching into a wide open mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.1: (2) For stealing, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.3: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth five _māsaka_ coins or more than five _māsakas_, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.4: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth more than one _māsaka_ coin but less than five _māsakas_, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.5: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth one _māsaka_ coin or less than one _māsaka_, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.1: (3) For intentionally killing a human being, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.3: when one digs a pit for people, thinking, “Falling into it someone will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.4: when the person experiences pain after falling, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.5: when the person dies, one commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.1: (4) For untruthfully and groundlessly boasting about a superhuman quality, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.3: when, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.4: when one says, “Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.5: when the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:5.1: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.1: (1) (…) For emitting semen by means of effort, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.2: when one intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.3: when one intends and makes an effort, but semen is not emitted, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.4: the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.1: (2) For making physical contact with a woman, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.2: when one touches body with body, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.3: when one touches what is connected to the body with the body, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.4: when one touches what is connected to the body with what is connected to the body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.1: (3) For speaking indecently to a woman, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.2: when, referring to the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.3: when, referring to any part below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.4: when, referring to anything connected to the body, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.1: (4) For commending the satisfaction of one’s own desires, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.2: when one encourages a woman to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.3: when one encourages a eunuch to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.4: when one encourages an animal to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.1: (5) For acting as a matchmaker, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.2: when one accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.3: when one accepts the mission, and finds out the response, but does not report back, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.4: when one accepts the mission, but neither finds out the response, nor reports back, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.1: (6) For having a hut built by means of begging, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.2: when one is having it built, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.1: (7) For having a large dwelling built, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.2: when one is having it built, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.1: (8) For groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.2: when, without having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.3: when, having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.1: (9) For charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.2: when, without having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.3: when, having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.1: (10) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.1: (11) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, monks who side with a monk who is pursuing schism commit three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.2: after the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.3: after each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.4: when the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.1: (12) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is difficult to correct commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.1: (13) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is a corrupter of families commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:19.1: The thirteen rules entailing suspension are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.0.2: 4.1 The sub-chapter on the robe-making season
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.1: (1) For keeping an extra robe more than ten days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.1: (2) For staying apart from one’s three robes for one day, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.1: (3) For receiving out-of-season robe-cloth and then keeping it for more than a month, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.1: (4) For getting an unrelated nun to wash a used robe, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.2: when one is getting her to wash it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.3: when one has got it washed, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.1: (5) For receiving a robe from the hand of an unrelated nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.2: when one is in the process of taking it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.3: when one has taken it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.1: (6) For asking an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.2: when one is in the process of asking, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.3: when one has asked, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.1: (7) For asking an unrelated male or female householder for too much robe-cloth, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.2: when one is in the process of asking, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.3: when one has asked, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.1: (8) For approaching, without first being invited, an unrelated householder and specifying the kind of robe one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.2: when one is in the process of  specifying it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.3: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.1: (9) For approaching, without first being invited, unrelated householders and specifying the kind of robe one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.2: when one is in the process of  specifying it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.3: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.1: (10) For getting a robe after prompting more than three times and standing more than six times, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.2: when one is getting it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.3: when one has got it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:30.1: The first sub-chapter on the robe-making season is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.1: (11) For having a blanket made that contains silk, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.1: (12) For having a blanket made entirely of black wool, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.1: (13) For having a new blanket made without using one measure of white wool and one measure of brown, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.1: (14) For having a blanket made every year, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.1: (15) For having a new sitting-blanket made without incorporating a one-standard-hand-span piece from the border of an old blanket, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.1: (16) For receiving wool and then taking it more than 40 kilometers, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.2: when one goes beyond 40 kilometers with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.3: when one goes beyond with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.1: (17) For getting an unrelated nun to wash wool, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.2: when one is getting her to wash it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.3: when one has got it washed, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.1: (18) For receiving money, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.2: when one is in the process of  taking it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.3: when one has taken it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.1: (19) For trading with money in various ways, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.2: when one is in the process of  trading, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.3: when one has traded, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.1: (20) For bartering in various ways, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.2: when one is in the process of  bartering, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.3: when one has bartered, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:41.1: The second sub-chapter on silk is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.1: (21) For keeping an extra bowl over ten days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.1: (22) For exchanging a bowl with less than five mends for a new bowl, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.2: when one is in the process of exchanging it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.3: when one has exchanged it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.1: (23) For receiving medicines and then keeping them for more than seven days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.1: (24) For looking for a rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of the hot season, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.2: when one is in the process of  looking for it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.3: when one has looked for it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.1: (25) For giving away a robe to a monk and then taking it back in anger, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.2: when one is in the process of  taking it back, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.3: when one has taken it back, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.1: (26) For asking for thread and then having weavers weave robe-cloth, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.2: when one is having it woven, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.3: when one has had it woven, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.1: (27) For going, without first being invited, to an unrelated householder’s weavers and then specifying the kind of robe-cloth one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.2: when one is in the process of  specifying it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.3: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.1: (28) For receiving a haste-cloth and then keeping it beyond the robe season, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.1: (29) For storing one of one’s three robes in an inhabited area and then staying apart from it for more than six days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.1: (30) For diverting to oneself material support that one knows is intended for the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.2: when one is in the process of  diverting it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.3: when one has diverted it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:52.1: The third sub-chapter on bowls is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:52.2: The thirty rules on relinquishment and confession are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.0.1: 5. The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.1: (1) For lying in full awareness, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.2: For lying in full awareness, one commits five kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.3: when, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.4: when one groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.5: when one says, “Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.6: when the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.7: when one lies in full awareness, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.1: (2) For speaking abusively, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.2: when one speaks abusively to one who is fully ordained, one commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.3: when one speaks abusively to one who is not fully ordained, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.1: (3) For engaging in malicious talebearing, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.2: when one engages in malicious talebearing to one who is fully ordained, one commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.3: when one engages in malicious talebearing to one who is not fully ordained, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.1: (4) For instructing a person who is not fully ordained to memorize the Teaching, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.2: when one is in the process of instructing, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.3: for every line, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.1: (5) For sleeping more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.2: when one is in the process of lying down, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.3: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.1: (6) For sleeping in the same sleeping place as a woman, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.2: when one is in the process of lying down, then the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.3: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.1: (7) For giving a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.2: when one is in the process of teaching, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.3: for every line, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.1: (8) For truthfully telling a person who is not fully ordained of a superhuman quality, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.2: when one is in the process of telling, then the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.3: when one has told, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.1: (9) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.2: when one is in the process of telling, then the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.3: when one has told, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.1: (10) For digging the earth, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.2: when one is in the process of digging, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.3: for every strike, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:63.1: The first sub-chapter on lying is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.1: (11) For having plants felled, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.2: when one is having them felled, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.3: for every strike, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.1: (12) For speaking evasively, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.2: when one speaks evasively without having been charged with evasive speech, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.3: when one speaks evasively after having been charged with evasive speech, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.1: (13) For complaining about a monk, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.2: when one is in the process of  complaining, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.3: when one has complained, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.1: (14) For taking a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a stool belonging to the Sangha and putting it outside, and then departing without putting it away or taking leave, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.2: when one goes beyond the distance of a stone-throw with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.3: when one goes beyond with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.1: (15) For putting out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, and then departed without putting it away or taking leave, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.2: when one goes beyond the boundary with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.3: when one goes beyond with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.1: (16) For arranging one’s sleeping place, in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, in a way that encroaches on a monk that one knows arrived there before one, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.2: when one is in the process of lying down, then the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.3: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.1: (17) For angrily throwing a monk out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.2: when one is in the process of throwing him out, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.3: when one has thrown him out, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.1: (18) For sitting down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.2: when one is in the process of sitting down, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.3: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.1: (19) For applying more than two or three courses, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.2: when one is in the process of applying them, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.3: when one has applied them, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.1: (20) For pouring water that one knows contains living beings onto grass or clay, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.2: when one is in the process pouring, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.3: when one has poured it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:74.1: The second sub-chapter on plants is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.1: (21) For instructing the nuns without being agreed upon, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.2: when one is in the process of instructing, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.3: when one has instructed, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.1: (22) For instructing the nuns after sunset, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.2: when one is in the process of instructing, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.3: when one has instructed, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.1: (23) For going to the nuns’ dwelling place and instructing the nuns, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.2: when one is in the process of instructing, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.3: when one has instructed, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:78.1: (24) For saying that the monks are instructing the nuns for the sake of worldly gain, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:78.2: when one is in the process of saying it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:78.3: when one has said it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:79.1: (25) For giving robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:79.2: when one is in the process of giving it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:79.3: when one has given it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:80.1: (26) For sewing a robe for an unrelated nun, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:80.2: when one is in the process of sewing it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:80.3: for every stitch, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:81.1: (27) For traveling by appointment with a nun, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:81.2: when one is in the process of traveling, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:81.3: when one has traveled, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:82.1: (28) For boarding a boat by appointment with a nun, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:82.2: when one is in the process of boarding, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:82.3: when one has boarded, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:83.1: (29) For eating almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:83.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:83.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:84.1: (30) For sitting in private alone with a nun, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:84.2: when one is in the process of sitting down, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:84.3: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:85.1: The third sub-chapter on the instruction is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:86.1: (31) For eating more than that at a public guesthouse, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:86.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:86.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:87.1: (32) For eating in a group, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:87.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:87.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:88.1: (33) For eating one meal before another, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:88.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:88.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:89.1: (34) For accepting more than two or three bowlfuls of pastries, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:89.2: when one is in the process of  taking it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:89.3: when one has taken it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:90.1: (35) For having finished one’s meal and refused an invitation to eat more, and then eating staple or non-staple food that is not left over, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:90.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:90.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:91.1: (36) For inviting a monk, whom one knows has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more, to eat staple or non-staple food that is not left over, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:91.2: when, because of what one says, the other receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:91.3: when the meal is finished, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:92.1: (37) For eating staple or non-staple food at the wrong time, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:92.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:92.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:93.1: (38) For storing and then eating staple or non-staple food, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:93.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:93.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:94.1: (39) For eating fine foods that one has asked for for oneself, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:94.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:94.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:95.1: (40) For eating food that has not been given, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:95.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:95.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:96.1: The fourth sub-chapter on eating is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:97.1: (41) For giving staple or non-staple food to a naked ascetic, to a male wanderer, or to a female wanderer with one’s own hands, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:97.2: when one is in the process of giving it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:97.3: when one has given it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:98.2: (42) For saying to a monk, “Come, let’s go to the village or town for alms,” and then, whether one has had food given to him or not, sending him away, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:98.3: when one is in the process of sending him away, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:98.4: when one has sent him away, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:99.1: (43) For sitting down intruding on a lustful couple, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:99.2: when one is in the process of sitting down, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:99.3: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:100.1: (44) For sitting down in private on a concealed seat with a woman, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:100.2: when one is in the process of sitting down, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:100.3: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:101.1: (45) For sitting down in private alone with a woman, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:101.2: when one is in the process of sitting down, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:101.3: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:102.1: (46) For being invited to a meal and then visiting families beforehand or afterwards, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:102.2: when one crosses the threshold with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:102.3: when one crosses with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:103.1: (47) For asking for more medicines than that, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:103.2: when one is in the process of asking, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:103.3: when one has asked, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:104.1: (48) For going to see an army in action, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:104.2: when one is in the process of going, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:104.3: wherever one stands to see it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:105.1: (49) For staying with the army for more than three nights, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:105.2: when one is staying, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:105.3: when one has stayed, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:106.1: (50) For going to a battle, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:106.2: when one is in the process of going, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:106.3: wherever one stands to see it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:107.1: The fifth sub-chapter on naked ascetics is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:108.1: (51) For drinking alcoholic drinks, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:108.2: when one receives with the intention to drink, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:108.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:109.1: (52) For making a monk laugh by tickling, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:109.2: when one is in the process of making him laugh, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:109.3: when one has made him laugh, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:110.1: (53) For playing in water, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:110.2: when one is playing in water less than ankle deep, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:110.3: when one is playing in water more than ankle deep, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:111.1: (54) For being disrespectful, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:111.2: when one is in the process of doing it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:111.3: when one has done it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:112.1: (55) For scaring a monk, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:112.2: when one is in the process of scaring him, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:112.3: when one has scared, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:113.1: (56) For lighting a fire to warm oneself, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:113.2: when one is in the process of lighting it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:113.3: when one has lit it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:114.1: (57) For bathing at intervals of less than a half-month, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:114.2: when one is in the process of bathing, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:114.3: when the bath is finished, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:115.1: (58) For using a new robe without first applying one of the three kinds of stain, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:115.2: when one is using it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:115.3: when one has used it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:116.1: (59) For transfering a robe to a monk, to a nun, to a trainee nun, to a novice monk, or to a novice nun, and then using it without it first being relinquished, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:116.2: when one is using it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:116.3: when one has used it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:117.1: (60) For hiding a monk’s bowl, robe, sitting-mat, needle-case, or belt, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:117.2: when one is in the process of hiding it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:117.3: when one has hid it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:118.1: The sixth sub-chapter of alcoholic drinks is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.0: 5.7 The sub-chapter on containing living beings
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.1: (61) For intentionally killing a living being, how many kinds of offences does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.2: For intentionally killing a living being, one commits four kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.4: when one digs a non-specific pit, thinking, “Whatever falls into it will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.5: when a person falls into it and dies, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.6: when a spirit, ghost, or animal in human form falls into it and dies, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.7: when an animal falls into it and dies, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:120.1: (62) For using water that one knows contains living beings, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:120.2: when one is using it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:120.3: when one has used it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:121.1: (63) For reopening a legal issue that one knows has been legitimately settled, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:121.2: when one is in the process of reopening it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:121.3: when one has reopened it, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:122.1: (64) For knowingly concealing a monk’s grave offense, one commits one kind of offence: an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:123.1: (65) For giving the full ordination to a person one knows is less than twenty years old, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:123.2: when one is in the process of giving the full ordination, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:123.3: when one has given the full ordination, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:124.1: (66) For knowingly traveling by appointment with a group of thieves, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:124.2: when one is traveling, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:124.3: when one has traveled, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:125.1: (67) For traveling by appointment with a woman, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:125.2: when one is in the process of traveling, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:125.3: when one has traveled, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:126.1: (68) For not giving up a bad view when pressed up to three times, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:126.2: after the motion, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:126.3: when the last announcement is finished, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:127.1: (69) For living with a monk who one knows is saying such things, who has not made amends according to the rule, and who has not given up that view, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:127.2: when one living with him, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:127.3: when one has lived with him, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:128.1: (70) For supporting a novice monk who one knows has been expelled in this way, one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:128.2: when one supports him, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:128.3: when one has supported him, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:129.1: The seventh sub-chapter on containing living beings is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:130.3: when one is in the process of saying it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:130.4: when one has said it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:132.2: when one , one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:132.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:136.2: when one , the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:136.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:137.1: (78) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:137.2: when going with the intention to hear, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:137.3: if one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:138.1: (79) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:138.2: when one , the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:138.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:139.2: when one , one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:139.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:140.2: when one , the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:140.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:141.1: (82) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:141.2: when one is diverting it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:141.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:142.1: The eighth sub-chapter on legitimacy is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:143.1: (83) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:143.2: when one , one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:143.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:144.1: (84) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:144.2: when one is in the process of taking it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:144.3: when one has taken it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:145.2: when one , one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:145.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:146.1: (86) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:146.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:146.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:147.1: (87) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:147.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:147.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:148.1: (88) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:148.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:148.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:149.1: (89) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:149.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:149.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:150.1: (90) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:150.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:150.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:151.1: (91) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:151.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:151.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.1: Having a robe made the measure of a Well-farer’s robe, how many offences does one fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.2: (92) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.3: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.4: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:153.1: The ninth sub-chapter on kings is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:153.2: The section on minor rules is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.0: 6. The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.1: Eating solid food or soft food, having accepted it with his own hand from the hand of a nun who is not a relation (and) has entered among the houses, how many offences does he fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.2: Eating … he falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.3: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.5: Eating … he falls into these two offences. [1]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.1: Eating without restraining a nun who is giving directions he falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.1: Eating solid food or soft food among families agreed upon as learners, having accepted it with his own hand he falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.1: Eating solid food or soft food in forest lodgings, not announced beforehand, having accepted it with his own hand within a monastery, how many offences does he fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.2: Eating … he falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.3: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.5: Eating … in forest lodgings he falls into these two offences. [4]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:158.1: Concluded are the four offences to be Confessed
pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.1: Dressing, out of disrespect, with the inner robe hanging down in front or behind, how many offences does he fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.2: Dressing, out of disrespect … he falls into one offence:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.4: Dressing, out of disrespect … he falls into this one offence. [1]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:160.1: Out of disrespect putting on the upper robe hanging down in front or behind, he falls into one offence:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:161.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses having uncovered the body, he falls into one offence

pli-tv-pvr1.2:167.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses with (the robes) lifted up …

pli-tv-pvr1.2:197.1: Out of disrespect covering up the curry or the condiment with conjey …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:198.1: Out of disrespect eating curry or conjey having asked for it for oneself if one is not ill …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:199.1: Out of disrespect looking at the bowls of others captious-mindedly …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:200.1: Out of disrespect making up a large mouthful …

pli-tv-pvr1.2:214.1: Out of disrespect eating while making a hissing sound …

pli-tv-pvr1.2:219.1: Out of disrespect throwing out amid the houses the rinsings of the bowl with lumps of boiled rice …

pli-tv-pvr1.2:221.1: with a staff in his hand …
